sources.title: Gunsmoke Ranch
sources.description: Taken from IMDB : Flagg is relocating flood victims to Gunsmoke Ranch. The Three Mesquiteers know Flagg to be a crook and try to warn them. They ignore the warning and improve the land only to find that it has been condemned for a new dam.

sources.title: Gunsmoke Ranch
sources.description: The Three Mesquiteers protect settlers against an evil politician trying to steal their land after a flood. You can find more information regarding this film on its IMDb page .

sources.title: Gunsmoke Ranch (1937)  THE THREE MESQUITEERS
sources.description:
Stars:Robert Livingston, Ray Corrigan, Max Terhune
 Director:Joseph Kane

 Flagg is relocating flood victims to Gunsmoke Ranch. The Three Mesquiteers know Flagg to be a crook and try to warn them. They ignore the warning and improve the land only to find that it has been condemned for a new dam.

sources.title: 1937 - Gunsmoke Ranch - A killer to be foiled---a fortune to be saved...excitement rules the range!
sources.description:
A land swindler vs. the West's wiliest "The Three Mesquiteers"trio in a race against rising waters.
Slick conman Phineas T. Flagg "relocates" flood victims to worthless Arizona ranchland. When the Three Mesquiteers uncover his dam scheme, they must outsmart his gang before the valley floods. Can these quick-draw heroes save the settlers from disaster?

Alternative title: The Three Mesquiteers
Colorized version https://youtu.be/LAhQNf8-Lyo


Director: Joseph Kane
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL2gsu7VGzgdYDDUshEcMs1CHZW1booguo
Writers: Oliver Drake, Jack Natteford, William Colt MacDonald
Stars: Robert Livingston, Ray Corrigan, Max Terhune
Stunts by Yakima Canutt (Stagecoach, Ben-Hur)

Genres: Western, Adventure, Comedy
Release date: May 5, 1937
Budget: $35,000 
Filming location: Alabama Hills, Lone Pine, California,

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=UUMOycDFnpMeWzaITQSD1dWsOA

@CultCinemaClassics

metadata.Plot: During the Great Depression, when natural catastrophes including floods destroy the homes of thousands,.crooked, con man Phineas Flagg buys up all the ranches in Arizona's Gunsmoke Valley at the bargain price of $2 per acre. The displaced families are only too happy to buy what Flagg misrepresents as 40 acres of prime farmland per family at the bargain price of $50 an acre. What he doesn't tell the migrants is that the entire area has been condemned under the law of eminent domain and will soon be flooded for the construction of a new dam. The group's leader, Judge Warren, initially disregards the Mesquiteers' warnings that they're being conned,, but Stony' romances his beautiful granddaughter Marion,, and the settlers accept the Mesquiteers' help,, but is it too late?
metadata.Writer: Oliver Drake, Jack Natteford, William Colt MacDonald
metadata.Actors: Robert Livingston, Ray Corrigan, Max Terhune
